+name: Deploy changed courses
+
+on:
+  workflow_dispatch:  # Allows manual triggering of the workflow
+    inputs:
+      environment: 
+        description: 'Environment'
+        required: true
+        options: 
+          - dev
+          - demo
+          - prod
+
+jobs:
+  validate-input:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Validate environment input
+        run: |
+          if [[ ! "${{ github.event.inputs.environment }}" =~ ^(dev|demo|prod)$ ]]; then
+            echo "Error: Environment must be one of 'dev', 'demo', 'prod'"
+            exit 1
+          fi
+        shell: bash
\ No newline at end of file

@@ -0,0 +1,146 @@
+name: Conditional Daily Deployment Preparation (Weekdays Only)
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    # Runs at 9:00 AM GMT, Monday through Friday
+    - cron: '0 9 * * 1-5'
+    # Runs at 9:00 AM GMT, only on Mondays and Wednesdays
+    # - cron: '0 9 * * 1,3'
+  workflow_dispatch:  # Allows manual triggering of the workflow
+
+jobs:
+  check-for-changes:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    outputs:
+      has_changes: ${{ steps.check-changes.outputs.has_changes }}
+      new_release_tag: ${{ steps.create-tag-name.outputs.new_release_tag }}
+      latest_release_tag: ${{ steps.latest_release.outputs.latest_release_tag }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4 
+
+      - name: Fetch all tags
+        run: git fetch --tags
+
+      - name: Ensure main is fetched
+        run: |
+          git fetch --unshallow || true
+          git fetch origin main:refs/remotes/origin/main
+
+      - name: Install GitHub CLI
+        run: |
+          if ! gh --version &>/dev/null; then
+            sudo apt update
+            sudo apt install -y gh
+          fi
+
+      - name: Fetch the latest release
+        id: latest_release
+        env:
+          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+        run: |
+          RELEASES=$(gh api repos/${{ github.repository }}/releases --paginate)
+          LATEST_RELEASE=$(echo "$RELEASES" | jq -r '.[] | select(.draft == false and .prerelease == false) | .tag_name' | head -n 1)
+          
+          if [ -n "$LATEST_RELEASE" ]; then
+            echo "latest_release_tag=$LATEST_RELEASE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT # To share with other jobs
+            echo "LATEST_RELEASE=$LATEST_RELEASE" >> $GITHUB_ENV # To share with the next steps in this job
+          fi
+
+      - name: Check for branches and tags
+        run: |
+          echo Printing branches:
+          echo $(git branch -a)
+          echo ------
+          echo Printing tags:
+          echo $(git tag)
+
+      - name: Check for changes
+        id: check-changes
+        run: |
+          if [ -n "$LATEST_RELEASE" ]; then
+            CHANGES=$(git diff --name-only "$LATEST_RELEASE"..origin/main)
+            echo "$CHANGES"
+            if [ -n "$CHANGES" ]; then
+              echo changes found - changes true
+              echo "has_changes=true" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
+            else
+            echo no changes - changes false
+              echo "has_changes=false" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
+            fi
+          else
+            echo no latest release - changes false
+            echo "has_changes=false" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
+          fi
+
+      - name: Create new release name
+        id: create-tag-name
+        run: |
+          DATE=$(date +'%y.%m.%d')
+          TAG_NAME="v$DATE"
+          echo "new_release_tag=$TAG_NAME" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+          echo $TAG_NAME
+
+  prepare-deployment:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    needs: check-for-changes
+    if: ${{ needs.check-for-changes.outputs.has_changes == 'true' }} 
+    env: 
+      NEW_RELEASE_TAG: ${{ needs.check-for-changes.outputs.new_release_tag }}
+      LATEST_RELEASE_TAG: ${{ needs.check-for-changes.outputs.latest_release_tag }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+      
+      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
+        id: setup-python
+        with:
+          python-version: "3.9"
+      
+      - uses: actions/cache@v3
+        id: cache-virtualenv
+        with:
+          path: ".virtualenv"
+          key: "python-${{ steps.setup-python.outputs.python-version }}-${{ hashFiles('requirements.txt') }}"
+
+      # If we weren't able to pull down a cache of the virtual environment then
+      # build one.
+      - if: steps.cache-virtualenv.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+        run: make --no-print-directory require-virtualenv
+
+      - name: Fetch all tags
+        run: git fetch --tags
+      
+      - name: Generate diffs
+        run: |
+          echo Start preparing deplooyment with release name: "$NEW_RELEASE_TAG"
+          python3 tools/prepare-deploy.py -t "$NEW_RELEASE_TAG" -p "$LATEST_RELEASE_TAG" -g "$GITHUB_WORKSPACE"
+      
+      - name: Zip Generated Folder
+        run: |
+          mv diffs deploys/"$NEW_RELEASE_TAG"/diffs
+          zip -r files.zip deploys/"$NEW_RELEASE_TAG"/
+      
+      - name: Upload files
+        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: diffs-artifact
+          path: files.zip
+
+  create-draft-release:
+    needs: [prepare-deployment, check-for-changes]
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    env: 
+      NEW_RELEASE_TAG: ${{ needs.check-for-changes.outputs.new_release_tag }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Download artifacts
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
+      
+      - name: Create Draft Release
+        env:
+          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+        run: |
+          gh release create "$NEW_RELEASE_TAG" --draft --title "$NEW_RELEASE_TAG" --notes "This is an auto-generated draft release." diffs-artifact/files.zip
\ No newline at end of file

+import argparse
+import glob
+import os
+import subprocess
+from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor, as_completed
+
+class DiffGenerator:
+    def __init__(self):
+        pass
+
+    def parse_arguments(self):
+        parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Process some integers.")
+        parser.add_argument("-f", "--workspace_path", required=True, help="Workspace path")
+        return parser.parse_args()
+
+    def list_files(self, pattern, exclude=None):
+        files = glob.glob(pattern, recursive=True)
+        if exclude:
+            files = [f for f in files if all(x not in f for x in exclude)]
+        return files
+
+    def get_production_courses(self):
+        return sorted({f.split('/')[1] for f in self.list_files('courses/*/course.json', exclude=["intro-to-vr", "zzz-engineering-demo"])})
+
+    def get_production_projects(self):
+        return sorted({(f.split('/')[1], f.split('/')[3]) for f in self.list_files('courses/*/projects/*/project.json', exclude=["intro-to-vr", "zzz-engineering-demo"])})
+
+    def get_demo_courses(self):
+        return sorted({f.split('/')[1] for f in self.list_files('courses/*/course.json', exclude=[]) if "intro-to-vr" in f})
+
+    def get_demo_projects(self):
+        return sorted({(f.split('/')[1], f.split('/')[3]) for f in self.list_files('courses/*/projects/*/project.json', exclude=[]) if "intro-to-vr" in f})
+
+    def run_make_commands(self, workspace_path, courses, environment, is_project=False):
+        def make_command(course):
+            course_name, project_name = course if is_project else (course, None)
+            make_command = "make project-normalize-" if is_project else "make course-normalize-"
+            course_path = f"{workspace_path}/diffs/courses/{course_name}"
+            env_folders = ['prod', 'local'] if environment != 'demo' else ['demo', 'local']
+            output = ""
+            for env in env_folders:
+                os.makedirs(f"{course_path}/{env}", exist_ok=True)
+                output_file = f"{course_path}/{env}/{project_name}.norm" if project_name else f"{course_path}/{env}/00-course.norm"
+                env_command = f"ENVIRONMENT={environment}" if environment else ""
+                project_command = f"PROJECT={project_name}" if project_name else ""
+                command = f"{make_command}{'remote' if env != 'local' else 'local'} COURSE={course_name} {project_command} {env_command} > {output_file} 2>&1"
+                result = subprocess.run(command, shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
+                if result.returncode > 0:
+                    output = f"{output} \nSTDOUT: {result.stdout}\nSTDERR: {result.stderr}\nReturn code: {result.returncode}"
+
+            return output
+
+        with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=1) as executor:
+            future_to_course = {executor.submit(make_command, course): course for course in courses}
+            
+            # Collect and process results
+            for future in as_completed(future_to_course):
+                course = future_to_course[future]
+                try:
+                    result_output = future.result()
+                    print(f"Normalized: {course}: {result_output}")
+                except Exception as exc:
+                    print(f"{course} generated an exception: {exc}")
+
+    def generate(self, workspace_path):
+        # Production
+        production_courses = self.get_production_courses()
+        production_projects = self.get_production_projects()
+        self.run_make_commands(workspace_path, production_courses, 'prod')
+        self.run_make_commands(workspace_path, production_projects, 'prod', is_project=True)
+
+        # Demo
+        self.run_make_commands(workspace_path, self.get_demo_courses(), 'demo')
+        self.run_make_commands(workspace_path, self.get_demo_projects(), 'demo', is_project=True)

+import argparse
+import glob
+import os
+import subprocess
+import json
+
+def parse_arguments():
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Process deployment preparation.')
+    parser.add_argument('-f', '--file_name', required=True, help='Output file name')
+    args = parser.parse_args()
+    return args.file_name
+
+def get_all_courses():
+    courses = [os.path.basename(course) for course in glob.glob('diffs/courses/*')]
+    courses.sort()
+    return courses
+
+def get_course_projects(course):
+    project_files = glob.glob(f'diffs/courses/{course}/*/*.norm')
+    project_names = set()
+    for file_path in project_files:
+        if "00-course" not in file_path:
+            project_name = os.path.basename(file_path).replace('.norm', '')
+            project_names.add(project_name)
+    
+    projects = {}
+    for project in sorted(project_names):
+        try:
+            with open(f'courses/{course}/projects/{project}/project.json') as f:
+                project_data = json.load(f)
+                projects[project] = project_data.get('id', '')
+        except FileNotFoundError:
+            pass
+    return projects
+
+def get_change_indicator(file_path):
+    if os.path.exists(file_path):
+        result = subprocess.run(['diff', '-w', '-B', file_path, file_path.replace('/prod/', '/local/').replace('/demo/', '/local/')], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE)
+        return ' ' if result.returncode == 0 else 'x'
+    return '?'
+
+def main():
+    file_name = parse_arguments()
+
+    with open(file_name, 'w') as output_file, open('all-used-project-ids', 'w') as id_file:
+        for course in get_all_courses():
+            message = ''
+            if course in ['hour-of-code', 'intro-to-vr', 'zzz-*']:
+                message = "(DO NOT IMPORT INTO DEMO)" if course == 'hour-of-code' else "(DO NOT IMPORT INTO PRODUCTION)" if course == 'intro-to-vr' else "(DO NOT IMPORT INTO DEMO OR PRODUCTION)"
+            
+            course_indicator = get_change_indicator(f'diffs/courses/{course}/prod/00-course.norm') or get_change_indicator(f'diffs/courses/{course}/demo/00-course.norm')
+            output_file.write(f"- [ ] {course} COURSE={course} {message}\n")
+            output_file.write(f"  * [{course_indicator}] course.json\n")
+
+            projects = get_course_projects(course)
+            for project, project_id in projects.items():
+                project_indicator = get_change_indicator(f'diffs/courses/{course}/prod/{project}.norm') or get_change_indicator(f'diffs/courses/{course}/demo/{project}.norm')
+                project_line = f"  * [{project_indicator}] {project} {project_id}\n" if project_id else f"  * [{project_indicator}] {project} {project_id} (NOT WIRED INTO COURSE)\n"
+                output_file.write(project_line)
+                id_file.write(project_id + '\n')
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    main()

+#!/bin/bash
+
+tag_name=""
+previous_release_tag=""
+
+while getopts ":f:p:w:" opt; do
+  case ${opt} in
+    f )
+      tag_name=$OPTARG
+      ;;
+    p )
+      previous_release_tag=$OPTARG
+      ;;
+    w )
+      github_workspace_path=$OPTARG
+      ;;
+    \? )
+      echo "Usage: cmd [-f results_folder] [-p previous_release_tag] [-w github workspace or the root folder to save documents]"
+      exit 1
+      ;;
+  esac
+done
+
+# Check if the results new tag name was provided
+if [ -z "$tag_name" ]; then
+    echo "You must specify the new tag name using the -f option. For example: ./prepare-deploy.sh -f <new-tag> -p <previous-release-tag>"
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+# Check if the results new tag name was provided
+if [ -z "$previous_release_tag" ]; then
+    echo "You must specify the previous release tag name using the -p option. For example: ./prepare-deploy.sh -f <new-tag> -p <previous-release-tag>"
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+# Check if the results new tag name was provided
+if [ -z "$github_workspace_path" ]; then
+    echo "You must specify the path to save the diffs using the -w option. For example: ./prepare-deploy.sh -f <new-tag> -p <previous-release-tag> -w <github_workspace_path>"
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+echo "Tag name: $tag_name"
+echo "Previous release tag: $previous_release_tag"
+
+# Define the full path to the results directory based on the provided folder name
+results_dir="./deploys/${tag_name}"
+
+# Check if the results directory exists, if not, create it
+if [ ! -d "$results_dir" ]; then
+    mkdir -p "$results_dir"
+fi
+
+echo "Starting the deployment preparation..."
+echo "Generating diffs..."
+echo $github_workspace_path
+chmod +x ./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-diffs.sh
+./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-diffs.sh -f "$github_workspace_path"
+deploy_status=$?
+
+if [ $deploy_status -ne 0 ]; then
+    echo "Generate diffs failed with status $deploy_status."
+    exit $deploy_status
+else
+    echo "Generate diffs successful."
+fi
+
+echo "Generating diff report..."
+
+chmod ./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-diff-report.sh
+./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-diff-report.sh -f "$results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report.md"
+diff_status=$?
+
+if [ $diff_status -ne 0 ]; then
+    echo "Diff report generation failed with status $diff_status. Check $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report.md for details."
+    exit $diff_status
+else
+    echo "Diff report generated successfully. Details are saved in $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report.md"
+fi
+
+echo "Genereting diff report changes only"
+grep -v "\[x\]" $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report.md > $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report-changes-only.md
+diff_status=$?
+
+if [ $diff_status -ne 0 ]; then
+    echo "Diff report changes only generation failed with status $diff_status. Check $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report-changes-only.md for details."
+    exit $diff_status
+else
+    echo "Diff report changes only generated successfully. Details are saved in $results_dir/curriculum-deploy-report-changes-only.md"
+fi
+
+echo "Generating git diff report..."
+
+chmod +x tools/deploy/deploy-generate-git-diff.sh
+./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-git-diff.sh $previous_release_tag > "$results_dir/git-diff-changes.md"
+diff_status=$?
+
+if [ $diff_status -ne 0 ]; then
+    echo "Git diff report generation failed with status $diff_status. Check $results_dir/git-diff-changes.md for details."
+    exit $diff_status
+else
+    echo "Git diff report generated successfully. Details are saved in $results_dir/git-diff-changes.md"
+fi
+
+
+echo "Deployment preparation completed. Check the folder $results_dir for the results."

+def run_make_commands(workspace_path, courses, environment, is_project=False):

+import argparse
+import os
+import subprocess
+import sys
+from deploy.diff_generator import DiffGenerator 
+
+def parse_arguments():
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Prepare deployment process.')
+    parser.add_argument('-t', '--tag_name', required=True, help='New tag name.')
+    parser.add_argument('-p', '--previous_release_tag', required=True, help='Previous release tag name.')
+    parser.add_argument('-g', '--github_workspace_path', required=True, help='GitHub workspace or the root folder to save documents.')
+    return parser.parse_args()
+
+def search_and_log_errors(start_path, log_file_path):
+    log_found = False
+    with open(log_file_path, 'w') as log_file:  # Open log file in write mode
+        for root, dirs, files in os.walk(start_path):
+            for file in files:
+                file_path = os.path.join(root, file)
+                with open(file_path, 'r', errors='ignore') as f:
+                    file_content = f.read()
+                    if 'Error' in file_content:
+                        print(f"Found 'Error' in: {file_path}")
+                        # Append the file content to the log file
+                        log_file.write(f"Traceback found in {file_path}:\n{file_content}\n\n---\n\n")
+
+def main():
+    args = parse_arguments()
+
+    diff_generator = DiffGenerator()
+    
+    # Print received arguments
+    print(f"Tag name: {args.tag_name}")
+    print(f"Previous release tag: {args.previous_release_tag}")
+
+    # Define the full path to the results directory
+    results_dir = os.path.join("./deploys", args.tag_name)
+
+    # Check if the results directory exists, if not, create it
+    os.makedirs(results_dir, exist_ok=True)
+
+    print("Starting the deployment preparation... Generating diffs...")
+    diff_generator.generate(args.github_workspace_path)
+    print("Generate diffs successful.")
+
+    print("Generating diff report...")
+
+    # TODO: The python script is not working as expected. Needs further investigation.
+    # generate_diff_report_cmd = ["python3", "./tools/deploy/generate-diff-report.py", "-f", os.path.join(results_dir, "curriculum-deploy-report.md")]
+    generate_diff_report_cmd = ["./tools/deploy/deploy-generate-diff-report.sh", "-f", os.path.join(results_dir, "curriculum-deploy-report.md")]
+
+    diff_status = subprocess.run(generate_diff_report_cmd).returncode    
+
+    if diff_status != 0:
+        print(f"Diff report generation failed with status {diff_status}. Check {results_dir}/curriculum-deploy-report.md for details.")
+        sys.exit(diff_status)
+    else:
+        print(f"Diff report generated successfully. Details are saved in {results_dir}/curriculum-deploy-report.md")
+
+    print("Generating diff report changes only...")
+    with open(os.path.join(results_dir, "curriculum-deploy-report.md"), "r") as report, open(os.path.join(results_dir, "curriculum-deploy-report-changes-only.md"), "w") as report_changes_only:
+        for line in report:
+            if "[x]" not in line:
+                report_changes_only.write(line)
+
+    print("Generating Git diff report...")
+    
+    git_diff_cmd = ["git", "diff", "--name-status", args.previous_release_tag, "origin/main"]
+    
+    git_diff_output_path = os.path.join(results_dir, "git-diff-changes.md")
+    
+    with open(git_diff_output_path, "w") as git_diff_file:
+        try:
+            subprocess.run(git_diff_cmd, stdout=git_diff_file, check=True)
+            print("Git diff report generated successfully. Details are saved in", git_diff_output_path)
+        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
+            print(f"Git diff report generation failed with status {e.returncode}. Check {git_diff_output_path} for details.")
+            sys.exit(e.returncode)
+
+    print("Generating error report...")
+    error_file_path = os.path.join(results_dir, "normalization_errors.md")
+    search_and_log_errors('diffs/', error_file_path)
+
+    print(f"Deployment preparation completed. Check the folder {results_dir} for the results.")
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    main()
